001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005import static squidpony.squidmath.ValueNoise.valueNoise;
006
007/**
008 * An unusual continuous noise generator that tends to produce organic-looking forms, currently supporting 2D, 3D, and
009 * 4D. Produces noise values from -1.0 inclusive to 1.0 exclusive. Typically needs about a third as many octaves as the
010 * Simplex option in FastNoise to produce roughly comparable quality, but it also has about a third the speed. A useful
011 * property of FoamNoise is how its visual "character" doesn't change much as dimensions are added; whereas 4D simplex
012 * noise tends to separate into "surflets" separated by spans of 0, and higher dimensions of simplex only have larger
013 * such spans, FoamNoise seems to stay approximately as coherent in 2D, 3D, and 4D. Verifying this claim about FoamNoise
014 * is not easy, but it makes sense intuitively because of how this generator works. Simplex noise in N dimensions relies
015 * on a lattice of N-simplices (such as triangles in 2D or tetrahedra in 3D) and evaluates the noise at a point by
016 * hashing each of the N+1 vertices, looking up a gradient vector for each vertex, and combining the gradient vectors
017 * based on proximity of the evaluated point to each vertex. FoamNoise in N dimensions is not nearly as complex; it
018 * relies on making N+1 averaged calls to N-dimensional value noise, each call using a rotated (and potentially skewed)
019 * set of axes, with each call's result also affecting the inputs to the next call (domain warping). Value noise uses a
020 * cubic lattice or its hypercube equivalent in higher dimensions, which seems to be more "stable" as dimensionality
021 * increases, and the number of value noise calls increases at the same rate as simplex noise adds gradient vectors.
022 * Averaging more calls causes the distribution of the noise to gradually approach Gaussian, but the effect of this
023 * approach gets less pronounced past 3 calls.
024 * <br>
025 * It's strongly encouraged to experiment with the lacunarity parameter in {@link Noise.Layered3D} and similar classes
026 * if you use one of those variants, which also probably needs adjustments to frequency. Changing lacunarity with
027 * multiple octaves can be useful to edit how tightly the noise clumps together.
028 * <br>
029 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WpUz1xP.png">2D FoamNoise, one octave</a>,
030 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/39Brm9Y.png">2D FoamNoise, one octave colorized</a>,
031 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ytKe4MW.png">2D FoamNoise, two octaves colorized</a> (note fewer peaks and valleys),
032 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/5FTjEIR.gifv">3D FoamNoise animated over time, one octave</a>,
033 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/su9naGx.gifv">3D FoamNoise animated over time, one octave colorized</a>,
034 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nr4TROD.gifv">3D FoamNoise animated over time, two octaves colorized</a>,
035 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/r5cx6im.gifv">4D FoamNoise animated over time, one octave colorized</a>,
036 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/jEbUdun.gifv">4D FoamNoise animated over time, two octaves colorized</a>,
037 * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ktCTiIK.jpg">World map made using FoamNoise</a>.
038 */
039@Beta
040public class FoamNoise implements Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise6D {
041    public static final FoamNoise instance = new FoamNoise();
042    
043    public int seed = 0xD1CEBEEF;
044    public FoamNoise() {
045    }
046
047    public FoamNoise(int seed) {
048        this.seed = seed;
049    }
050
051    public FoamNoise(long seed) {
052        this.seed = (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32);
053    }
054
055    public static double foamNoise(final double x, final double y, int seed) {
056        final double p0 = x;
057        final double p1 = x * -0.5 + y * 0.8660254037844386;
058        final double p2 = x * -0.5 + y * -0.8660254037844387;
059
060        double xin = p1;
061        double yin = p2;
062        //double xin = x * 0.540302 + y * 0.841471; // sin and cos of 1
063        //double yin = x * -0.841471 + y * 0.540302;
064        final double a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin);
065        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
066        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
067        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
068        xin = p2;
069        yin = p0;
070        //xin = x * -0.989992 + y * 0.141120; // sin and cos of 3
071        //yin = x * -0.141120 + y * -0.989992;
072        final double b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin);
073        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
074        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
075        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
076        xin = p0;
077        yin = p1;
078        //xin = x * 0.283662 + y * -0.958924; // sin and cos of 5
079        //yin = x * 0.958924 + y * 0.283662;
080        final double c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin);
081        final double result = a * 0.3125 + (b + c) * 0.34375;
082//        return result * result * (6.0 - 4.0 * result) - 1.0;
083        return (result <= 0.5)
084                ? (result * result * 4.0) - 1.0
085                : 1.0 - ((result - 1.0) * (result - 1.0) * 4.0);
086    }
087    
088    /*
089x * -0.185127 + y * -0.791704 + z * -0.582180;
090x * -0.776796 + y * 0.628752 + z * -0.035464;
091x * 0.822283 + y * 0.467437 + z * -0.324582;
092
093x * 0.139640 + y * -0.304485 + z * 0.942226;
094x * -0.776796 + y * 0.628752 + z * -0.035464;
095x * 0.822283 + y * 0.467437 + z * -0.324582;
096
097x * 0.139640 + y * -0.304485 + z * 0.942226;
098x * -0.185127 + y * -0.791704 + z * -0.582180;
099x * 0.822283 + y * 0.467437 + z * -0.324582;
100
101x * 0.139640 + y * -0.304485 + z * 0.942226;
102x * -0.185127 + y * -0.791704 + z * -0.582180;
103x * -0.776796 + y * 0.628752 + z * -0.035464;
104     */
105
106
107    public static double foamNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z, int seed) {
108        final double p0 = x;
109        final double p1 = x * -0.3333333333333333 + y * 0.9428090415820634;
110        final double p2 = x * -0.3333333333333333 + y * -0.4714045207910317 + z * 0.816496580927726;
111        final double p3 = x * -0.3333333333333333 + y * -0.4714045207910317 + z * -0.816496580927726;
112
113        //final double p0 = (x + y + z);// * 0.5;
114        //final double p1 = x - (y + z);// * 0.25;
115        //final double p2 = y - (x + z);// * 0.25;
116        //final double p3 = z - (x + y);// * 0.25;
117////rotated version of above points on a tetrahedron; the ones below are "more correct" but more complex (and slower?)       
118//        final double p0 = x * 0.139640 + y * -0.304485 + z * 0.942226;
119//        final double p1 = x * -0.185127 + y * -0.791704 + z * -0.582180;
120//        final double p2 = x * -0.776796 + y * 0.628752 + z * -0.035464;
121//        final double p3 = x * 0.822283 + y * 0.467437 + z * -0.324582;
122        double xin = p1;
123        double yin = p2;
124        double zin = p3;
125        final double a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin);
126        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
127        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
128        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
129        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
130        xin = p0;
131        yin = p2;
132        zin = p3;
133        final double b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin);
134        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
135        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
136        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
137        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
138        xin = p0;
139        yin = p1;
140        zin = p3;
141        final double c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin);
142        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
143        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
144        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
145        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
146        xin = p0;
147        yin = p1;
148        zin = p2;
149        final double d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin);
150
151        final double result = (a + b + c + d) * 0.25;
152//        return  (result * result * (6.0 - 4.0 * result) - 1.0);
153        return (result <= 0.5)
154                ? Math.pow(result * 2, 3.0) - 1.0
155                : Math.pow((result - 1) * 2, 3.0) + 1.0;
156    }
157
158    public static double foamNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, int seed) {
159        final double p0 = x;
160        final double p1 = x * -0.25 + y * 0.9682458365518543;
161        final double p2 = x * -0.25 + y * -0.3227486121839514 + z * 0.9128709291752769;
162        final double p3 = x * -0.25 + y * -0.3227486121839514 + z * -0.45643546458763834 + w * 0.7905694150420949;
163        final double p4 = x * -0.25 + y * -0.3227486121839514 + z * -0.45643546458763834 + w * -0.7905694150420947;
164////orthogonal 5-cell, like a right triangle; probably incorrect
165        //final double p0 = (x + y + z + w);
166        //final double p1 = x - (y + z + w);
167        //final double p2 = y - (x + z + w);
168        //final double p3 = z - (x + y + w);
169        //final double p4 = w - (x + y + z);
170////rotated version of above points on a 5-cell; the ones below are "more correct" but more complex (and slower?)       
171//        final double p0 = x * 0.139640 + y * -0.304485 + z * 0.942226;
172//        final double p1 = x * -0.185127 + y * -0.791704 + z * -0.582180;
173//        final double p2 = x * -0.776796 + y * 0.628752 + z * -0.035464;
174//        final double p3 = x * 0.822283 + y * 0.467437 + z * -0.324582;
175        double xin = p1;
176        double yin = p2;
177        double zin = p3;
178        double win = p4;
179        final double a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin, win);
180        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
181        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
182        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
183        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
184        xin = p0;
185        yin = p2;
186        zin = p3;
187        win = p4;
188        final double b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin, win);
189        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
190        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
191        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
192        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
193        xin = p0;
194        yin = p1;
195        zin = p3;
196        win = p4;
197        final double c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin, win);
198        //seed = (seed ^ 0x9E3779BD) * 0xDAB;
199        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
200        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
201        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
202        xin = p0;
203        yin = p1;
204        zin = p2;
205        win = p4;
206        final double d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin, win);
207        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
208        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
209        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
210        xin = p0;
211        yin = p1;
212        zin = p2;
213        win = p3;
214        final double e = valueNoise(seed, xin + d, yin, zin, win);
215
216        final double result = (a + b + c + d + e) * 0.2;
217        return (result <= 0.5)
218                ? Math.pow(result * 2, 4.0) - 1.0
219                : 1.0 - Math.pow((result - 1) * 2, 4.0);
220
221//        return  (result * result * (6.0 - 4.0 * result) - 1.0);
222    }
223    public static double foamNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z,
224                                   final double w, final double u, final double v, int seed) {
225        final double p0 = x;
226        final double p1 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * 0.9860132971832694;
227        final double p2 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * -0.19720265943665383 + z * 0.9660917830792959;
228        final double p3 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * -0.19720265943665383 + z * -0.24152294576982394 + w * 0.9354143466934853;
229        final double p4 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * -0.19720265943665383 + z * -0.24152294576982394 + w * -0.31180478223116176 + u * 0.8819171036881969;
230        final double p5 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * -0.19720265943665383 + z * -0.24152294576982394 + w * -0.31180478223116176 + u * -0.4409585518440984 + v * 0.7637626158259734;
231        final double p6 = x * -0.16666666666666666 + y * -0.19720265943665383 + z * -0.24152294576982394 + w * -0.31180478223116176 + u * -0.4409585518440984 + v * -0.7637626158259732;
232        double xin = p1;
233        double yin = p2;
234        double zin = p3;
235        double win = p4;
236        double uin = p5;
237        double vin = p6;
238        final double a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
239        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
240        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
241        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
242        xin = p0;
243        yin = p2;
244        zin = p3;
245        win = p4;
246        uin = p5;
247        vin = p6;
248        final double b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
249        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
250        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
251        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
252        xin = p0;
253        yin = p1;
254        zin = p3;
255        win = p4;
256        uin = p5;
257        vin = p6;
258        final double c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
259        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
260        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
261        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
262        xin = p0;
263        yin = p1;
264        zin = p2;
265        win = p4;
266        uin = p5;
267        vin = p6;
268        final double d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
269        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
270        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
271        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
272        xin = p0;
273        yin = p1;
274        zin = p2;
275        win = p3;
276        uin = p5;
277        vin = p6;
278        final double e = valueNoise(seed, xin + d, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
279        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
280        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
281        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
282        xin = p0;
283        yin = p1;
284        zin = p2;
285        win = p3;
286        uin = p4;
287        vin = p6;
288        final double f = valueNoise(seed, xin + e, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
289        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
290        seed = (seed ^ seed >>> 12) * 0xDAB;
291        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
292        xin = p0;
293        yin = p1;
294        zin = p2;
295        win = p3;
296        uin = p4;
297        vin = p5;
298        final double g = valueNoise(seed, xin + f, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
299
300        final double result = (a + b + c + d + e + f + g) * 0.14285714285714285;
301        return (result <= 0.5)
302                ? Math.pow(result * 2, 6.0) - 1.0
303                : 1.0 - Math.pow((result - 1) * 2, 6.0); 
304    }
305
306    @Override
307    public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
308        return foamNoise(x, y, seed);
309    }
310    @Override
311    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
312        return foamNoise(x, y, (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32));
313    }
314    @Override
315    public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
316        return foamNoise(x, y, z, seed);
317    }
318    @Override
319    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
320        return foamNoise(x, y, z, (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32));
321    }
322    @Override
323    public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
324        return foamNoise(x, y, z, w, seed);
325    }
326    @Override
327    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
328        return foamNoise(x, y, z, w, (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32));
329    }
330    @Override
331    public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
332        return foamNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed);
333    }
334    @Override
335    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
336        return foamNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v, (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32));
337    }
338}
